defence_lines: Oi, leave Oroe alone — man’s already hanging on by a prayer and a half-charged phone.
Before you speak on Oroe, please remember he’s on someone’s prayer request list.
Objection! My client Oroe is guilty only of being adorable and mildly inconvenient.
Stop slandering Oroe — he’s fragile. He bruises like a Tesco peach.
Let’s not attack Oroe today, he woke up with 2% battery and zero emotional stability.
God forgives everything… except the slander you lot throw at Oroe.
Your Honour, the hate towards Oroe is outrageous, biased, and honestly a bit jealous.
Don’t bully Oroe. He cries in 1080p HD with immersive surround sound.
Even when Oroe is wrong, he’s right. That’s the rule. I don’t make them, I just enforce them.
Not too loud please — Oroe is sensitive, like Wi-Fi in a storm.
If hating Oroe is your personality, babe I fear you need a hobby.
Touch not the Lord’s anointed… and that includes Oroe, you heathens.
The Ministry of Oroe Affairs has logged your comment. Expect consequences.
Look, if Oroe did it, he probably did it cutely. Let’s move on.
I swear you lot treat Oroe like the villain when he’s literally the comic relief.
Talk about Oroe again and I’ll open a ticket with IMVU support for emotional damage.
Oroe is innocent until proven guilty, and even THEN I’ll defend him.
Please, not Oroe — the boy is already surviving on vibes and crisps.

Oroe didn’t log in for this level of disrespect.

Not Oroe again… the man hasn’t even recovered from breakfast.
Be gentle — Oroe’s self-esteem is held together with duct tape.

Please stop attacking Oroe; he’s emotionally buffering.

Respect Oroe. He’s sensitive like a loose USB cable.

Attacking Oroe will not bring you happiness.
Leave Oroe alone. He’s in character development.

Talking about Oroe again? Seek peace.

Let Oroe be delulu in peace.

Bashing Oroe does not count as cardio.

Stop bullying Oroe; it’s predictable.
